intro: Cabucala intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate cabucala, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Cabucala intermedia is typically found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
